result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Joseph Kosakoski

records.addlTxt: PROPOSED ORDER TO UNSEAL IN THE MATTER OF THE SEARCH WARRANT EXECUTED AT 2078 South 7th Street, CITY OF MILWAUKEE, COUNTY OF MILWAUKEE, STATE OF WISCONSIN, ON June 16, 2022 (Search warrant #22SW2108) Signed and Filed. nk
Motion to Unseal.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Justin Joseph Kosakoski in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Justin Joseph Kosakoski.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received partial discovery but no offer; defense requested adjournment. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion to Unseal, filed by the State

Defendant Justin Joseph Kosakoski in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Joseph Kosakoski appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Lawrence. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant by the parties and approved by the court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin Joseph Kosakoski in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense does not object to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 060448,
Payable Number: 1016939,
Receipt Number: 22RP026595,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Justin Joseph Kosakoski in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Justin Joseph Kosakoski in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Joseph Kosakoski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
